name: Matchstick Relay
description:
Brandon Lyman (myself) - I am a self-taught Unity/C# developer with an aspiration of getting a full time job making real-time 3D applications. Although I am primarily interested in programming, I have experience with level design, lighting, audio, and animation in Unity. This is my third shipped project and I believe it is my best piece. 

Adam Babcock - Adam is the mastermind behind the sound effects in Matchstick Relay, and the aspiring studio musician behind the unique percussion soundtrack that really brings the game to life. He enjoys writing new music, editing it using Pro Tools (a music industry-standard DAW), and providing entertainment to the public through his TikTok (@adam_babcock). This is Adam's first time making a video game, so show him some support and follow him on TikTok!

Check out Adam's TikTok! https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMeuStrdG/

Brandon's Github - https://github.com/TheIndieDream

Brandon's LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/brandonclyman/

Interested in how Matchstick Relay was made? Check out the DevLog (link at the bottom of this page)! Or, reach out to me (Brandon) via Itch.io, or send me an email at TheIndieDream@Outlook.com. I am always happy to share, and I always appreciate feedback on my code!

Interested in how Matchstick Relay's soundscape came alive? Send Adam a message on TikTok (@adam_babcock)!

Other Credits:

Made with Unity.

Art:

Unity Technologies -  https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/essentials/tutorial-projects/unity-particl... - I used this asset pack to create the flame and water effects in the game. 

BG Studios - https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/2d/textures-materials/sky/free-hdr-skyboxe... - I used a skybox from this asset pack to give the game a sunset atmosphere. Thank you so much for your beautiful artwork!

Special Thanks:

My fiance, who supported my obsessive working on this project.

My two best friends from college, for playtesting the heck out of Matchstick Relay and really helped to find bugs and inconsistencies. I can't thank you guys enough!

Jason Wiemann - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCX_b3NNQN5bzExm-22-NVVg - Who's videos helped developed my passion for this kind of work.

Check out the devlog for more awesome YouTube videos that helped us build Matchstick Relay!

And thank you so much for reading!
